narrativeStructure.firstIsland: Brine dripping from spear creates Onogoro Island
narrativeStructure.marriageRitual: Divine couple circle sacred pillar, perform marriage
narrativeStructure.jewel edSpear: Ame-no-Nuboko (Heavenly Jeweled Spear) stirs primordial ocean
narrativeStructure.islandBirth: Birth of eight major islands of Japan
narrativeStructure.divineCouple: Izanagi (male) and Izanami (female) commanded to create land
narrativeStructure.firstKami: Spontaneous generation of first kami in Takamagahara
narrativeStructure.primordialChaos: Void of heaven and earth undifferentiated
narrativeStructure.kamiBirth: Generation of myriad kami - mountains, rivers, wind, trees, etc.

historicalContext.purpose: Establish divine legitimacy of Japanese imperial line and sacred nature of Japanese islands
historicalContext.politicalContext: Compiled during Nara period to consolidate imperial authority
historicalContext.sources: Kojiki (712 CE) and Nihon Shoki (720 CE)

description: The Creation of Japan is the foundational myth of Japanese cosmology, recorded in the Kojiki (712 CE) and Nihon Shoki (720 CE). After the spontaneous generation of the first kami in Takamagahara (the High Plain of Heaven), the divine couple Izanagi and Izanami descended to the primordial ocean and stirred the cosmic waters with a jeweled spear, giving birth to the islands of Japan and the myriad kami that inhabit them.

significance.ritualTemplate: Establishes marriage rituals and sacred procession patterns
significance.imperialLegitimacy: Emperor descends from Amaterasu, granddaughter of Izanagi/Izanami
significance.shintoFoundation: All natural features are kami or kami-inhabited
significance.nationalIdentity: Japanese islands as unique divine creation
significance.sacredGeography: Establishes Japan as divinely created land, not mere territory

name: Japanese Mythology
